summary:
• Motivated and hardworking individual passionate about putting ideas and imaginations into the right words. 
• Loves to explore new ideas by taking inspiration from every step along the way.
• A voracious reader, passionate story-teller and poet, art enthusiast and an ardent animal lover. 
• Enjoys experimenting with different cuisines.

Key skills:
• Content writing, copywriting, proofreading, editing and marketing
• Story/fiction writing
• Poetry and prose
• Self-learning
• Communication and customer interaction

projects.title: Stepping Back In Time - Dordrecht
projects.description:
• An entertaining write-up for the Autumn 2020 issue of ACCESS magazine depicting the beauty of Dordrecht city in south Netherlands.
• Basking in its glory as the oldest city of the country with a 800-year-old rich history, the article describes the various modes of commuting to the city, and the magical views and fun activities that it offers to tourists and residents alike.

projects.title: 75 Years of Liberation and Freedom
projects.description:
• A write-up for the Spring 2020 issue of the ACCESS magazine describing the commemoration of the 75th year of Dutch Liberation after the World War II.
• Depicts the feelings of the Dutch nationals about the 75 years of freedom and the importance of liberation, while remembering those who lost their lives in the war.
• Provides an elaborate list of carnivals, concerts, games and gatherings which everyone is welcome to be a part of.

projects.title: An Incredible Connection
projects.description:
• An elaborate article for the 'Arts and Entertainment' section of the 2019 Winter issue of the ACCESS magazine, depicting a South African woman's discovery about her ancestral connection to a Dutch painter having lived centuries ago.
• Describes the extensive research conducted to gather information about the Dutch ancestor, with manuscripts and original paintings provided by the Rijksmuseum (Dutch national museum dedicated to arts and history).
• Talks about the emotions felt upon discovering a long lost relation with the country you are living in, and getting a sense of belonging.

projects.title: Stress and Burnout
projects.description:
• A short write-up for the Summer 2019 issue of ACCESS magazine about the causes and effects of stress and burnout, and different ways to combat them.
• Explains how stress can be hazardous to the physical and mental well-being, ultimately leading to burnout and various methods of fighting or preventing it, with counselors, yoga instructors and mental health professionals sharing their opinions and expertise on the same.
• Specifies at what percentage stress and burnout are prevalent in the Netherlands, and possible means of dealing with it.

projects.title: Finding a home in the Netherlands
projects.description:
• An article for the Summer 2019 issue focusing on the different aspects of searching for a house, covering the most essential points with regard to renting and buying a house and the landlord's perspective.
• Provides extensive information about things to be considered and problems that can be avoided when it comes to renting a place or buying a property.

projects.title: Saudade: An Intersection of Archives and Arts (Book Review)
projects.description:
• A review article written for the 'Book Review' section of the Spring 2019 issue of the ACCESS magazine.
• Reviewed the book "Saudade: An Intersection of Archives and Arts" that was written as a commemoration of the 10th anniversary of the Expatriate Archive Center, Netherlands. 
• A detailed summary of how the book talks about the connection of ancient archival pieces with different forms of art, taking the readers and expats through a nostalgic ride of archives and art in their homeland.

projects.title: A Journey Through The Medieval Times
projects.description:
• An article written for the Summer 2018 issue for the 'Arts and Entertainment' section of the magazine.
• Covered an exhibition on the theme 'Knights and Castles' conducted at 'Museon', The Hague which describes the life and times during the Middle Ages and published a write-up in the magazine.
• A first-hand experience at journalism, involving co-ordination with the marketing and management team of the exhibition at Museon for conducting research and collecting extensive information about the exhibition.

projects.title: Open Monument Day 2017 (Openmonumentdag 2017)
projects.description:
• A write-up for the Autumn 2017 issue for the 'Arts and Entertainment' section of the magazine.
• Researched extensively about the 31st Open Monument Day, an event which takes place every year in the first weekend of September all across the Netherlands. It is an event when all the national monuments, old heritage places and museums are open to the public to visit for free.
• Met and interacted with the Dutch locals, municipalities and organizations for information about heritage monuments and co-ordinated with the City Archives Center in Amsterdam to collect inputs required for the article which are of help to the international community.

projects.title: Animals As Therapy
projects.description:
• An article for the Summer 2017 issue for the 'Health and Well-being' section of the quarterly published national magazine of ACCESS Netherlands.
• Gathered information about the benefits of animal-assisted therapy on patients with mental illnesses from various organizations and owners with therapy pets.

profile_positions.description:
As a self-employed content writer and copywriter, I am dedicated towards delivering crisp content/copy using the right and compelling words that will help you grow your business and attract more clients.

What can I offer you?
• A detailed, research-oriented and precisely edited copy on the kind of topic you want me to write on, including your special preferences, quotes or citations.
• Promotion of your brand/product through my content across different social media platforms.
• Number of rewrites/corrections in the copy depending on the length.
• Guidance on putting the content in the appropriate manner on your website for the best results.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
Expat Republic is a leading English media company aimed at helping expatriates living in the Netherlands. As a freelance writer with them, I contribute in writing useful and informative articles serving to the benefit of expats.

Areas covered:
• Travel
• Healthcare
• Food and beverage
• Housing
• Schooling and education
• Mental well-being
• Language courses
• Tips on saving money
• LGBTQ+ community
profile_positions.title: Web Content Writer

profile_positions.description:
As an information officer at ACCESS, my responsibilties primarily involved:
• Answering queries and providing solutions and guidance for different kinds of issues on settling in the Netherlands faced by newly arrived expats and internationals in the Netherlands over calls, emails and face-to-face.
• Staying on track with the latest changes and developments in different sectors and updating the internal database, so as to ensure the relevant and correct information being conveyed to the clients.
profile_positions.title: Information Officer

profile_positions.description:
ACCESS Netherlands is a not-for-profit organization working dedicatedly toward serving the international community for over 30 years. As a content writer, I mainly contributed toward:
• Conducting extensive research on various topics relevant and of help to the expats in the country by visiting heritage centers, museums, archives centers and public libraries and meeting locals to gather detailed information, old articles and transcripts.
• Documenting and editing articles based on the collected information for the company's quarterly published magazine.

Areas covered:
• Travel
• Pets
• Arts and entertainment
• History and culture
• Mental health and therapy
• Social events
• Real estate
profile_positions.title: Content Writer

profile_positions.description:
SkillTransfers is a dedicated team of community creators and learning experts working toward developing innovative and rewarding online learning strategies that fetch the best results. As a freelance writer, I contributed in writing some useful and enlightening articles on the current trends of digital education and tips on standing out in the job market with the right attitude and skills.

Areas covered:
• Digital education
• Lifestyle and work-life balance
• Work ethics
• Learning and upskilling
profile_positions.title: Web Content Writer

profile_positions.description:
DirectI is one of the leading domain registrars providing efficient services and powering millions of customers with their domain solutions and web hosting products. As a senior web solutions specialist, my responsibilities involved:
• Co-ordinating with different teams to handle top-level escalations.
• Recording, tracking and reporting problem activity to the product development team to improvise the product and the platform supporting the product.
• Building strategies to improve efficiency, profitability and quality of service to earn customer delight in form of maintaining SLA’s to solve escalated issues on priority.
• Training and mentoring newly joined executives for providing regional support.
• Documenting articles that helped in troubleshooting issues quickly.
profile_positions.title: Senior Web Solutions Specialist

profile_positions.description:
As a web solutions specialist with DirectI, my job primarily involved:
• Interacting with clients from across the globe through calls and emails, troubleshooting issues faced by clients in various websites, Domain Name System (DNS) consoles and hosting services, taking backups of data and emails, and helping with search engine optimization and content promotion for their websites.
• Conducting testing and analysis of products, platforms and services.
• Executing SQL queries to make database audit logs and reports for issues recorded and executing API calls to apply various constraints on selling domain names as per change in rules.

Publication: The Extra Mile
My job profile involved dealing with registration of domain names with various extensions and their configuration on the web. I had once helped a client transfer a .UK domain name from one account to another, studying the various rules and restrictions implied on the transfer.
profile_positions.title: Web Solutions Specialist

volunteer_experiences.description:
As a lunch-time and gym supervisor at the community school, my responsibilities involved:
• Accompanying the children (usually a group of 20-22) to the playground and back to the class.
• Keeping an eye on the children while they play.
• Making the children tidy up and line up after play-time in their respective groups.
• Interacting with the children during lunch-time and make sure they eat well.
• Accompanying the children to the gym near the school.
• Keeping a record in case of an injury, child not eating properly or other incidences.

• Represented ACCESS Netherlands at the "I am not a tourist" Expat Fair 2018 at Amsterdam. 
• Interacted with people visiting the ACCESS booth at the fair, explaining them in brief about what ACCESS does as an organization and promoting its services to potential partners and customers.

• Worked as an invigilator for the preliminary and final exams for secondary and higher secondary students. 
• Helped in arranging the question papers, giving access codes to students, and reading exam instructions.
• Co-ordinated with the IT team if students faced an issue with their online exams.
